title: 54 Best Prime Day Deals Under $100 Still Up for Grabs: Save on Tech, Toys, Luggage and More
description: Prime Day is over, but there's still time to take advantage of more than 50 unique deals under $100.
author: Aashna Gheewalla
byline: Aashna Gheewalla, Amber Guetebier, Jason Coles
excerpt: Prime Day is over, but there's still time to take advantage of more than 50 unique deals under $100.
text: Zooey Liao/CNETAlthough October Prime Day officially ended Wednesday, the deals haven't stopped. If you missed out on purchasing items during the big sales event, there are a number of enticing offers still available across a variety of categories, including tech, home goods and kitchen hardware. We've curated the best of the best under $100, many of which make ideal holiday gifts. But we wouldn't wait too long to buy, because these deals can expire at any minute. Hey did you know? CNET Deals texts are free, easy and save you money. We'll update this guide frequently for a short time after the sale, so be sure to check back often. And don't forget to take a look at our roundups of the best Prime Day deals under $50, $25 and $10 that are still available. Best Prime Day tech deals under $100 Beats/CNET These stylish Beats earbuds are packed full of features that make them a pretty great value when you can snag a pair at this all-time low price. They support active noise cancellation and spatial audio, have a battery life of up to 24 hours and boast an IPX4 water-resistance rating. The black, red and white color variants are all still on sale. More Prime Day tech deals under $100Samsung 990 Evo 1TB SSD: $70 (save $80 with on-page coupon). Your beverages can stay warm without you having to reheat them a million times.Apple AirTag 4-pack: $80 (save $19). Get four of Apple's top-rated tracking device and never lose your keys again.Jack Skellington Echo Dot: $63 (save $27). Order now to save 30% off this limited-edition Echo Dot with a Jack Skellington shell for an Oct. 24 arrival.Baseus Bowie 30 wireless earbuds: $37 (save $13 with on-page coupon). Rock out anywhere with this speaker from the legendary amplifier company.Beats Solo 4: $100 (save $100). The latest in the Beats Solo lineup, at half-off you can't go wrong.Ring indoor camera: $30 (save $30). Keep a tidy eye on your home's interior without spending a ton on a home security system. Best Prime Day home deals under $100 Cozy Earth/CNET Eco luxury brand Cozy Earth makes sustainable items both to wear and for the home, and this set of plush waffle towels in neutral shades of charcoal, gray or white will stand the test of time. Blueair/CNET Air purifiers are great for people with pets, allergies and other sensory or olfactory concerns. When is Amazon's Prime Day 2024 event? Amazon Prime Day comes every year in July. Amazon's second event, Prime Big Deals Days, is often referred to as October Prime Day. In 2024, it took place on Oct. 8 and 9. During the days leading up to, throughout and even after the event, you'll see a lot of great savings, especially on Amazon devices and popular items such as TVs, home security and other tech. For many, this now-annual fall shopping event is the kickoff for the holiday shopping season. Are Amazon Prime Day deals worth buying? Depending on what you are after, the short answer is yes. There are thousands of items discounted, including some deals that match or exceed the previous all-time low prices. Because Amazon stock can fluctuate wildly, there's no telling how long the item will remain on sale or available -- especially now that Prime Day has officially come and gone. Are other retailers having anti-Prime Deal Days sales? Every Prime Day event brings big savings from Amazon and that means Amazon's competitors offer discounts to entice customers as well. And this year was no different. Both Walmart and Best Buy rolled out their own slate of deals and discounts, with many offers matching or even occasionally beating Amazon's prices. Are products really cheaper on Prime Day?Products that are on sale on Prime Day are discounted to entice members. Whether or not it's the best deal will depend on how much Amazon is willing to take off and what its documented lowest price has been. You can also compare across competitors that usually like to take part in Prime Day with deals and discounts of their own. Watch this: How to Hack Amazon Prime Day: Shopping and Deals Advice 04:03 How we choose the best Amazon Prime Day dealsMany of us here at CNET have covered shopping events for several years, including Black Friday, Prime Day, Memorial Day and countless other sales. In that time, we've learned how to spot the best deals among a sea of thousands of superficial offers and scams, and we only surface the best offers from trusted retailers. We look for real discounts, quality reviews and remaining sale time when choosing the best deals to show you. Real discounts mean genuine savings. We check pricing history for products listed as on sale so we know when it's a case of an inflated list price rather than an actual discount. Quality reviews and testing are super important for any product. A discount isn't worthwhile if it results in a subpar product experience, no matter how much you saved. Remaining sale time is important, too. Some deals are only around for a short time or may be limited in supply. If that's the case, we'll let you know upfront so you don't come back to the deal later only to be disappointed.
html:
Although October Prime Day officially ended Wednesday, the deals haven't stopped. If you missed out on purchasing items during the big sales event, there are a number of enticing offers still available across a variety of categories, including tech, home goods and kitchen hardware. We've curated the best of the best under $100, many of which make ideal holiday gifts. But we wouldn't wait too long to buy, because these deals can expire at any minute.

Hey did you know? CNET Deals texts are free, easy and save you money.

We'll update this guide frequently for a short time after the sale, so be sure to check back often. And don't forget to take a look at our roundups of the best Prime Day deals under $50, $25 and $10 that are still available.

Best Prime Day tech deals under $100

These stylish Beats earbuds are packed full of features that make them a pretty great value when you can snag a pair at this all-time low price. They support active noise cancellation and spatial audio, have a battery life of up to 24 hours and boast an IPX4 water-resistance rating. The black, red and white color variants are all still on sale.

More Prime Day tech deals under $100

  • Samsung 990 Evo 1TB SSD: $70 (save $80 with on-page coupon). A perfect storage upgrade for gaming or work.
  • SanDisk 128GB microSDXC memory card with adaptor: $16 (save $5). This memory card has up to 190MBps read speeds and is the perfect accessory for gaming consoles like the Nintendo Switch.
  • Nextmug self-heating coffee mug: $100 (save $30). Your beverages can stay warm without you having to reheat them a million times.
  • Apple AirTag 4-pack: $80 (save $19). Get four of Apple's top-rated tracking device and never lose your keys again.
  • Jack Skellington Echo Dot: $63 (save $27). Order now to save 30% off this limited-edition Echo Dot with a Jack Skellington shell for an Oct. 24 arrival.
  • Baseus Bowie 30 wireless earbuds: $37 (save $13 with on-page coupon). These noise-canceling earbuds are designed for the active user, are waterproof and pack impressive bass sound.
  • Nzxt H7 Elite gaming PC case: $90 (save $90). A durable PC case with built-in RGB lighting and cooling support.
  • Hori Nintendo Switch split pad controller (light gray and yellow): $43 (save $7). Make gaming more accessible on your hands and wrists with Hori's Nintendo Switch controllers.
  • Marshall Emberton II portable Bluetooth speaker: $100 (save $70). Rock out anywhere with this speaker from the legendary amplifier company.
  • Beats Solo 4: $100 (save $100). The latest in the Beats Solo lineup, at half-off you can't go wrong.
  • Ring indoor camera: $30 (save $30). Keep a tidy eye on your home's interior without spending a ton on a home security system.

Best Prime Day home deals under $100

Eco luxury brand Cozy Earth makes sustainable items both to wear and for the home, and this set of plush waffle towels in neutral shades of charcoal, gray or white will stand the test of time.

Air purifiers are great for people with pets, allergies and other sensory or olfactory concerns. They can usually cost quite a bit, but this Amazon Prime deal saves you $20 on this Blueair HEPA air purifier. This small but mighty air purifier can remove pollutants from rooms that are up to 432 square feet in approximately 30 minutes.

More Prime Day home deals under $100

  • Bissell Little Green portable carpet cleaner: $100 (save $24). An easy-to-use carpet and upholstery cleaner perfect for quickly removing stains and spills.
  • Adjustable steel mesh zero gravity lounge chairs, 2-pack: $90 (save $40). Get ultimate comfort in your backyard or patio with these chairs that have built-in cup holders and pillows.
  • Levoit 6-liter smart humidifier: $69 (save $11). Add essential oils and your room will feel like a spa.
  • Beckham Hotel Collection bed pillows: $54 (save $26 with on-page coupon). Rest well on this Amazon shopper-favorite down alternative pillow.
  • Delta Children Heartland 4-in-1 convertible crib: $99 (save $71). A baby crib for an affordable price.
  • Peel-and-stick backsplash: $42 (save $8 with on-page coupon). Renovating your kitchen or bathroom has never been easier.
  • 14-inch, metal platform bed: $60 (save $40). No box springs are needed with this durable platform bed.
  • Amazon Basics foldable metal platform bed: $94 (save $6). This platform bed is excellent and heavy-duty, with no tools required to assemble it.
  • Govee Christmas lights 99-foot string: $100 (save $30 with on-page coupon). Get the holiday season started with these lights that come in just under $100.

Best Prime Day kitchen deals under $100

With a substantial 12-quart capacity and five different cooking functions, this Chefman multicooker is a versatile addition to any kitchen. It has a maximum temperature of 450 degrees Fahrenheit, and can air fry, roast, bake, dehydrate and even has a rotisserie function. Plus, the racks, pans and spit are dishwasher safe for an easy cleanup.

More Prime Day kitchen deals under $100

  • Mueller 6-quart cast-iron Dutch oven: $50 (save $40 with on-page coupon). Available in five colors.
  • Ninja BL660 professional compact blender: $100 (save $20). Blend smoothies, protein drinks, sauces and soups to perfection in mere seconds.
  • Keurig K-Slim single-serve coffee maker: $99 (save $31). Make four cups of single-serve coffee before refilling the reservoir.
  • Ninja 4-in-1 air fryer: $80 (save $50). Air fry, roast, bake, reheat and more.
  • 8-inch Kyoku Shogun Series Japanese steel core hammered kitchen knife: $79 (save $29 with on-page coupon). This beautiful, all-purpose knife can easily cut through meat, fish, fruit, vegetables and more.
  • Hamilton Beach food processor and vegetable chopper: $44 (save $11). Chop veggies or make hummus with this fast, powerful appliance.
  • Spigen keychain pocket knife: $60 (save $15 with on-page coupon). A high-quality knife with a multi-tool design for your everyday needs.
  • Meatmeet Pro smart WiFi wireless meat thermometer: $44 (save $56 with on-page coupon). Monitor the temperature and doneness of your meat dishes with minimal effort.
  • Ktkudy rechargeable electric pepper mill and salt grinder: $45 (save $10 with on-page coupon). The perfect gift for the gourmand in your life.

Best Prime Day health, beauty and wellness deals under $100

This water flosser has 10 different settings, a large reservoir and will leave your teeth cleaner than you ever thought possible. White colorway sold out.

More Prime Day health, beauty and wellness deals under $100

  • Renpho thermacool massage gun: $90 (save $50 with on-page coupon). Relax those sore, tense muscles without spending a fortune on a massage.
  • Clinique Almost lipstick in Black Honey: $20 (save $5). This wildly popular lipstick looks dark in the tube but adjusts to your lips and skin tone.
  • NuDerma portable skin therapy wand machine: $60 (save $10 with on-page coupon). This product has four attachments, to bring you smoother skin.
  • Body Restore shower steamers: $15 (save $15 with on-page coupon). Score 15 eucalyptus-infused shower tablets for that spa-like feeling every time you shower.
  • Meridian body hair trimmer: $50 (save $25). Waterproof, rechargeable and easy on your skin.

Best Prime Day fashion deals under $100

If you think all socks are created equal, wait until you squish your toes into a pair of Cozy Earth lounge socks. This price includes three pairs of socks.

More Prime Day fashion deals under $100

  • Delsey Paris Comete hardshell expandable luggage: $98 (save $42). Finding a piece of Delsey luggage for under $100 is rare.
  • Dr. Martens unisex Embury Chelsea boot: $92 (save $38). A versatile boot at a 34% discount, these Doc Martens look just as great with jeans as they do with sequin skirts.
  • Travelon Essentials anti-theft crossbody bag: $36 (save $28). Extra secure purse for travel days or every day.
  • London Fog women's Winley duck boot: $40 (save $20). Splash through puddles in style.
  • Delsey United Colors of Benetton hardside carryon: $85 (save $15). A sturdy carry on with bright color options.

Best Prime Day toys and games deals under $100

We know it's not even Halloween yet but the Star Wars Lego holiday countdown calendars frequently sell out, so why not order one now to get ahead of the game, especially at a discount.

More toys and games under $100

  • Super Mario Bros. Lego Piranha plant: $48 (save $12). This detailed 540-piece set is great for tweens, teens and adults.
  • Barbie Camper playset: $65 (save $35). Includes 60 accessories for all of Barbie's road-tripping needs.
  • Paw Patrol Lookout Tower with toy car launcher: $42 (save $8). Includes Chase's police cruiser.
  • Ticket to Ride board game: $33 (save $22). An excellent strategy game for your next family game night.
  • Hues & Clues board game: $20 (save $5). A fascinating game based on color perception, you can play with up to 10 people.
  • What Do You Meme? Family Edition: $13 (save $7). This viral game promises a night of family-friendly fun.
  • Magic the Gathering Duskmourn: House of Horror bundle: $43 (save $8). Show off your new deck and get into the Halloween spirit.
  • Joyin kids adjustable height basketball hoop: $30 (save $30 with coupon). Even Steph Curry had to start somewhere.

When is Amazon's Prime Day 2024 event?

Amazon Prime Day comes every year in July. Amazon's second event, Prime Big Deals Days, is often referred to as October Prime Day. In 2024, it took place on Oct. 8 and 9. During the days leading up to, throughout and even after the event, you'll see a lot of great savings, especially on Amazon devices and popular items such as TVs, home security and other tech. For many, this now-annual fall shopping event is the kickoff for the holiday shopping season.

Are Amazon Prime Day deals worth buying?

Depending on what you are after, the short answer is yes. There are thousands of items discounted, including some deals that match or exceed the previous all-time low prices. Because Amazon stock can fluctuate wildly, there's no telling how long the item will remain on sale or available -- especially now that Prime Day has officially come and gone.

Are other retailers having anti-Prime Deal Days sales?

Every Prime Day event brings big savings from Amazon and that means Amazon's competitors offer discounts to entice customers as well. And this year was no different. Both Walmart and Best Buy rolled out their own slate of deals and discounts, with many offers matching or even occasionally beating Amazon's prices.

Are products really cheaper on Prime Day?

Products that are on sale on Prime Day are discounted to entice members. Whether or not it's the best deal will depend on how much Amazon is willing to take off and what its documented lowest price has been. You can also compare across competitors that usually like to take part in Prime Day with deals and discounts of their own.

Watch this: How to Hack Amazon Prime Day: Shopping and Deals Advice

04:03

How we choose the best Amazon Prime Day deals

Many of us here at CNET have covered shopping events for several years, including Black Friday, Prime Day, Memorial Day and countless other sales. In that time, we've learned how to spot the best deals among a sea of thousands of superficial offers and scams, and we only surface the best offers from trusted retailers. We look for real discounts, quality reviews and remaining sale time when choosing the best deals to show you. 

  • Real discounts mean genuine savings. We check pricing history for products listed as on sale so we know when it's a case of an inflated list price rather than an actual discount. 
  • Quality reviews and testing are super important for any product. A discount isn't worthwhile if it results in a subpar product experience, no matter how much you saved. 
  • Remaining sale time is important, too. Some deals are only around for a short time or may be limited in supply. If that's the case, we'll let you know upfront so you don't come back to the deal later only to be disappointed.
